channel.title: Adding models to /raw in cache fail
channel.description: this is my first time adding models on a pi(used to delta) and im trying to add torva helm. i added the int for it in itemdef2 class with no errors when i compile and i put the .dat of the model in the raw folder in the cache with the rest of the models. when i try to open my client it shows the game crash black screen. but when i remove the .dat from the raw folder in cache it loads again.. idk if the .dat isnt for pi 317 or if im just doing something wrong... if anybody can help plz do asap cuz it is frustrating :eek:

item.title: Adding models to /raw in cache fail
item.dc:creator: @scenemo scenemo
item.description:
@scenemo wrote:

hmm i used a model checker and opened up the model to view it and its correct, i changed the model number and compiled now i can open up my client again (also changed the number on the int) but now when i try to do the add model # in game nothing happens and when i try to spawn the item it says item not found or w/e …progress atleast :3

Read full topic

item.source: Adding models to /raw in cache fail

item.title: Adding models to /raw in cache fail
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

You could try going into your client class and searching for void startUp() and either remove the // on //models(); or just add it. That packs the dat into the cache so that might help, might not. I’m still new to pi as well XD

here’s what I mean: http://snpr.cm/nfvEBy.jpg for me I would just remove the //, compile and it’ll pack it. also make sure that the int has the correct dat id.

Read full topic
